org.opends.guitools.controlpanel.datamodel

Class ControlPanelInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.guitools.controlpanel.datamodel.ControlPanelInfo

  • public class ControlPanelInfo
extends Object
    This is the classes that is shared among all the different places in the Control Panel. It contains information about the server status and configuration and some objects that are shared everywhere.

      • registerTask

        public void registerTask(Task task)
        Registers a task. The Control Panel creates a task every time an operation is made and they are stored here.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be registered.

      • mustReindex

        public boolean mustReindex(AbstractIndexDescriptor index)
        Tells whether an index must be reindexed or not.
        Parameters:
        index - the index.
        Returns:
        true if the index must be reindexed, false otherwise.

      • registerModifiedIndex

        public void registerModifiedIndex(AbstractIndexDescriptor index)
        Registers an index as modified. This is used by the panels to be able to inform the user that a rebuild of the index is required.
        Parameters:
        index - the index.

      • unregisterModifiedIndex

        public boolean unregisterModifiedIndex(AbstractIndexDescriptor index)
        Unregisters a modified index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index.
        Returns:
        true if the index is found in the list of modified indexes, false otherwise.

        Unregisters all the modified indexes on a given backend.
        Parameters:
        backendName - the name of the backend.

      • backupCreated

        public void backupCreated(BackupDescriptor newBackup)
        Informs that a backup has been created. The method will notify to all the backup listeners that a backup has been created.
        Parameters:
        newBackup - the new created backup.

      • backendPopulated

        public void backendPopulated(Set<BackendDescriptor> backends)
        Informs that a set of backends have been populated. The method will notify to all the backend populated listeners.
        Parameters:
        backends - the populated backends.

      • startPooling

        public void startPooling()
        Starts pooling the server configuration. The period of the pooling is specified as a parameter. This method is asynchronous and it will start the pooling in another thread.

      • stopPooling

        public void stopPooling()
        Stops pooling the server. This method is synchronous, it does not return until the pooling is actually stopped.

      • getTrustManager

        public ApplicationTrustManager getTrustManager()
        Returns the trust manager to be used by this ControlPanelInfo (and in general by the control panel).
        Returns:
        the trust manager to be used by this ControlPanelInfo.

        public int getConnectTimeout()
        Returns the timeout to establish the connection in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the timeout to establish the connection in milliseconds.

      • setConnectTimeout

        public void setConnectTimeout(int connectTimeout)
        Sets the timeout to establish the connection in milliseconds. Use 0 to express no timeout.
        Parameters:
        connectTimeout - the timeout to establish the connection in milliseconds. Use 0 to express no timeout.

      • getLdapsHostPort

        public HostPort getLdapsHostPort()
        Gets the LDAPS HostPort based in what is read in the configuration. It returns null if no LDAPS HostPort was found.
        Returns:
        the LDAPS HostPort to be used to connect to the server.

      • getAdminConnectorHostPort

        public HostPort getAdminConnectorHostPort()
        Gets the Administration Connector HostPort based in what is read in the configuration. It returns null if no Administration Connector HostPort was found.
        Returns:
        the Administration Connector HostPort to be used to connect to the server.

      • getLocalAdminConnectorHostPort

        public HostPort getLocalAdminConnectorHostPort()
        Gets the Administration Connector HostPort based in what is read in the local configuration. It returns null if no Administration Connector HostPort was found.
        Returns:
        the Administration Connector HostPort to be used to connect to the local server.

      • getLdapHostPort

        public HostPort getLdapHostPort()
        Gets the LDAP HostPort based in what is read in the configuration. It returns null if no LDAP HostPort was found.
        Returns:
        the LDAP HostPort to be used to connect to the server.

      • getStartTlsHostPort

        public HostPort getStartTlsHostPort()
        Gets the Start TLS HostPort based in what is read in the configuration. It returns null if no Start TLS HostPort is found.
        Returns:
        the Start TLS HostPort to be used to connect to the server.

      • connectUsingStartTLS

        public boolean connectUsingStartTLS()
        Tells whether we must connect to the server using Start TLS.
        Returns:
        true if we must connect to the server using Start TLS and false otherwise.

      • connectUsingLDAPS

        public boolean connectUsingLDAPS()
        Tells whether we must connect to the server using LDAPS.
        Returns:
        true if we must connect to the server using LDAPS, false otherwise.

      • mustDeregisterConfig

        public boolean mustDeregisterConfig()
        Returns true if the configuration must be deregistered and false otherwise. This is required when we update the configuration, in these cases cn=config must the deregistered and after that register again.
        Returns:
        true if the configuration must be deregistered and false otherwise.

      • setMustDeregisterConfig

        public void setMustDeregisterConfig(boolean mustDeregisterConfig)
        Sets whether the configuration must be deregistered or not.
        Parameters:
        mustDeregisterConfig - whether the configuration must be deregistered or not.

        Sets whether the server is local or not.
        Parameters:
        isLocal - whether the server is local or not.

      • isLocal

        public boolean isLocal()
        Returns whether we are trying to manage the local host.
        Returns:
        true if we are trying to manage the local host, false otherwise.

        the connection pool to be used by the LDAP entry browsers.

                                      throws ConfigException
